meanings.definition: A loose-fitting, sleeveless undergarment worn as a nightshirt or a slip.
meanings.sent1: She wore comfortable camisias to bed every night.
meanings.sent2: The store had a variety of camisias in different colors.
meanings.sent3: When she accidentally wore her camisias to work, everyone had a good laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her collection of camisias was like a rainbow in her closet.
meanings.sent5: The soft fabric of the camisias felt like a gentle hug.

meanings.definition: A long tunic worn by men in ancient Rome.
meanings.sent1: The actor looked regal in his camisias during the historical play.
meanings.sent2: In ancient Rome, camisias were a common attire for men.
meanings.sent3: The camisias made the actor feel like a Roman emperor.
meanings.sent4: His camisias flowed like a river as he walked on stage.
meanings.sent5: The intricate designs on the camisias were a symbol of status.
